Policy: Decree of 10 December 2014 amending the Regulation on the meat waste management.
Policy_Content: This Decree amends article 6 of the Regulation on the meat waste management. Amended article establishes that waste management of group I must be done following criteria of speed and safety, avoiding actions and incorrect manipulations that involve any type of risk. It prohibits to launch waste in other place than waste disposal area or, if available, in the warehouses or authorized areas for this purpose. It also establishes requirements to be satisfied in livestock farms for animal carcasses, which must be removed and taken to an authorized treatment centre. However, if corpses are in difficult areas, they can be buried, provided that the necessary measures are taken to avoid damaging the environment. Corpses found in areas of difficult access can also be used to feed wild animal species and particularly those of necrophagous birds that are in danger of extinction or in official protection programmes. In other production centres, the meat waste of group I can be kept in the same center for a maximum period of 48 hours, a term that can be extended if there is a warehouse with facilities of refrigeration. All production centres must contact a private meat waste manager to carry out the collection and transfer of meat residues to the treatment and disposal center.

Policy: Decision of the President of the Arab Republic of Egypt promulgating the Mineral Resources Law No.198 of 2014.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 44 articles aims at regulating search and exploitation operations for the raw materials of mines, quarries and salt pans. The Law is also applied to agreements of minerals and its exploitation. All the related licenses issued prior to this Law remain valid and license fees shall be adjusted. The Law provides for two main categories of mining licenses, that is, for (i) exploration; and (ii) production operations. An exploration license is granted for performing general survey, exploration and feasibility studies within the licensed area. A production operation license is granted for performing mining, construction, processing, and refining operations. Concerned body to run and manage the activity of mineral wealth in Egypt is the Egyptian Mineral Resources Authority (EMRA) which main tasks are: (i) Organization of the search and exploitation operations of ore mines and control over those operations, (ii) Technical supervision; (iii) Approval for issuing the licenses for mines (the license of search in mines is issued by the decision of the Minister or the Governor with the approval of the competent Authority); (iv) Conducting research and exploitation; (v) Suggesting areas of research and mining exploitation after the approval of the minister or the competent governor. The concerned Province is the managerial institution specialized in managing the quarries and salt pans located in its area and under the technical supervision of the Institution. The duration of the search license is two years, renewable for one period only, while the duration of the exploitation license is maximum of fifteen years and may be extended for five years.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Law on prevention of corruption.
Policy_Content: This Law prescribes measures and procedures aimed to prevent conflicts of public and private interest; regulates restrictions on the performance of public functions, submission of reports on income and property of public officials, protection of persons reporting threats to the public interest that indicate the existence of corruption, and other issues of importance for prevention and suppression of corruption. Corruption is any abuse of official, business, or social position or influence in order to gain personal gain or benefit for another. The Agency for the prevention of corruption is an independent and autonomous body, established by the Parliament of Montenegro, in accordance with this Law. A whistleblower, in the sense of this text, is a natural and legal person who submits a report on endangerment of public interests, which indicates the existence of corruption.

Policy: Regional Law No. 368 “On energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of energy saving and raising energy efficiency. The scope of this Regional Law shall be to set forth legal, economic and organizational grounds for stimulation of energy saving and raising energy efficiency. Basic principles of energy saving and raising energy efficiency shall be as follows: (a) priority of efficient and rational use of energy resources; (b) program approach to energy saving and improvement of energy efficiency; (c) tariff regulation of energy sector; (d) support and stimulation of energy saving and raising energy efficiency; (e) stimulation of energy servicing practices; (d) planning of energy saving and raising energy efficiency; and (e) stimulation of energy saving in economic activities.

Policy: Rajshahi Agricultural Development Bank Act, 2014 (Act No. 19 of 2014).
Policy_Content: The Act, consisting of 42 sections, establishes that the Rajshahi Agricultural Development Bank is a statutory body with permanent continuity having the power to acquire, possess, and transfer both movable and immovable property. The functions of this bank include: loans to people involved in agricultural, fisheries, livestock and poultry rearing and related industries, including cottage, fisheries and livestock industries. It specifies bank rules and procedures as well as advance payments. The bank may perform the following functions, namely: accept money as deposit; loan against the security of a property or in other way for business purposes; issue and sale of bonds and debentures; loans to small and medium enterprises (SME) subject to compliance with the provisions under the receipt and license of Bangladesh Bank;  procurement, stock and other items related to agriculture, fisheries and livestock resources equipment, materials, fertilizers, chemicals or other materials used in agriculture, etc.

Policy: Integrated Administration and Control Systen Ordinance.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the present Act is to transpose the Regulation (EU) No. 1306/2013 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 17 December 2013 on the financing, management and monitoring of the common agricultural policy into German legislation. In particular, the Act lays down provisions relating to the processing and use of data under the Integrated Administration and Control System in accordance with the provisions of the Union for agricultural payments. The text consists of 9 articles as follows: Purpose and sphere of application (1); Operating data (2); Collection, processing and use of data (3); Transmission of data by the paying agency to the certifying body (4); Transmission of data by the Paying Agent for the purpose of information exchange (5); Inspection of producer organizations by paying agencies (6); Extinguishing periods (7); Deviating national law (8); Empowerment (9). One Annex is enclosed listing operating data.

The Act determines requirements for the competent authorities of the states to nominate beneficiaries and to conduct monitoring compliance. Policy: Plan Nacional de Adaptación al Cambio Climático 2014.
Policy_Content: El Plan Nacional de Adaptación al Cambio Climático se constituye como el instrumento articulador de la política pública chilena de adaptación al cambio climático, cuya misión se ha definido como: Fortalecer la capacidad de Chile para adaptarse al cambio climático profundizando los conocimientos de sus impactos y de la vulnerabilidad del país y generando acciones planificadas que permitan minimizar los efectos negativos y aprovechar los efectos positivos, para su desarrollo económico y social y asegurando su sustentabilidad. Este plan entrega los lineamientos para la adaptación en Chile y proporciona la estructura operativa para la coordinación y coherencia de las acciones de los diferentes sectores, y diferentes niveles administrativos territoriales, considerando que la adaptación puede llevarse a cabo a nivel de un sector específico, a nivel multisectorial, a nivel regional o de manera transversal.

Policy: Stratégie de Croissance Accelerée et de Développement Durable (SCA2D) 2015-2019.
Policy_Content: La Stratégie de Croissance Accelerée et de Développement Durable (SCA2D) est un instrument à portée nationale, qui couvre la période 2015-2019, dont les objectifs globaux sont: a) renforcer les fondements d’une croissance économique, forte, viable, durable, équitable et inclusive; b) améliorer la qualité de vie de la population et garantir l’équité dans l’accès aux services sociaux de base; c) promouvoir le patrimoine naturel et culturel et l’utilisation optimale des ressources naturelles; d) renforcer la bonne gouvernance et résilience face à la fragilité politique. La SCA2D a retenu quatre axes stratégiques qui se complètent et interagissent pour réaliser la vision fondée sur une croissance accélérée, diversifiée, inclusive et génératrice d’emplois. Ces axes stratégiques sont les suivants: 1) Axe 1: Accélération, diversification et durabilité de la croissance; 2) Axe 2: Développement des infrastructures de soutien à la croissance; 3) Axe 3: Renforcement de l’accès aux services sociaux de base et à la résilience des ménages; 4) Axe 4: Renforcement de la gouvernance et des capacités de résilience institutionnelle et humaine.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Energy, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Water, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Ley Nº 127 - Suspensión de actividad minera metalífera.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley dispone suspender en todo el territorio provincial el inicio de cualquier actividad minera metalífera de primera categoría, establecidas en el inciso (a) del artículo 3º del Código de Minería Nacional. El objetivo de esta disposición es garantizar el cumplimiento de los principios ambientales preventivos, precautorios, de sustentabilidad y de equidad intergeneracional, establecidos en la Ley Nacional N° 25.675, en la actividad minera metalífera, como así también: a) garantizar el uso racional y sustentable de los recursos naturales; b) proteger los recursos hídricos; c) mantener el equilibrio y dinámica de los sistemas ecológicos; d) asegurar la conservación de la diversidad biológica; e) prevenir los efectos nocivos o peligrosos que las actividades antrópicas puedan generar sobre el ambiente; f) posibilitar la sustentabilidad ecológica, económica y social del desarrollo; g) minimizar los riesgos ambientales; h) prevenir la posibilidad de emergencias ambientales; i) remediar el impacto ambiental producido.

Policy: Decree No. 71/2014 approving the Regulation on Bio-Safety related to Genetically Modified Organism (GMO).
Policy_Content: This Decree approves the Regulation on Bio-Safety related to Genetically Modified Organisms (GMO). This Regulation, consisting of 74 articles divided into 11 Chapters and four Annexes, establishes the Bio-safety rules and enforcement mechanisms to import, export, transit, research, release into the environment, handling and use of organisms genetically modified (GMO) and their products, resulting from modern bio-technology, contributing to ensuring the protection of human health, the environment, and particularly the conservation of biological diversity and applies to all public and private entities involved in these operations by defining the powers of the National Authority of Bio-Security (ANB) and the bio-safety inter-institutional group (NBC), also regulating the processing for obtaining authorization, the risk assessment and management, information and accountability fidelity, inspection, confidentiality and public participation and access to information, and setting the fees and penalties. It is divided as follows: General provisions (Chap. I), Processing for obtaining authorization (Chap. II), Import export and transit of GMO (Chaps. III) Investigations (Chap. IV); Release into the environment and production (Chap. V); Transport, identification, packaging and labelling (Chap. VI); Risk assessment and management, information and responsibility (Chap. VII); Taxes, infractions e santions (Chap. VIII); Inspections (Chap. IX); Confidentiality (Chap. X); Public participation and access to information (Chap. XI). The four Annexes deal with model forms and fines.

Policy: Regional Law No. 3063-KZ “On the use of land by members of gardening, horticultural, suburban smallholding and non-profit associations of citizens”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that allotment of land plots to the gardening, horticultural, suburban smallholding and non-profit associations of citizens shall be performed by local government according to the place of residence of citizens. Land plots shall be allotted in accordance with land survey projects out of consolidated (or in the way of consolidation) land plots in ownership or on lease without tender. Members of gardening, horticultural, suburban smallholding and non-profit associations of citizens must comply with the following requirements: (a) use land plots in accordance with their purpose and classification by land category and authorized use in ways that should not cause damage to the environment, including land as a natural object; (b) preserve landmark, geodetic and other special signs established on land plots in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation; (c) perform land protection arrangements; (d) start using land plots in a timely manner in cases when the terms of development of land plots are envisaged by agreements; (e) make timely payments of land charges; (f) comply with the requirements of urban-planning regulations, construction, environmental, sanitary and hygienic, fire safety and other rules and regulations when using land plots; (g) prevent pollution, littering, degradation and deterioration of soil fertility on lands of relevant categories; and (h) comply with other requirements envisaged by Land Code of the Russian Federation and federal laws.

Policy: Climate Reporting Regulation (2014: 1434).
Policy_Content: These Regulations concerns climate reporting by national authorities and other public bodies required according to - 1. The United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change; 2. The Kyoto Protocol; 3. Decisions made under the Climate Convention or the Kyoto Protocol;  4. Regulation (EU) No 525/2013 and other selected EU legislation. The Swedish Environmental Protection Agency shall coordinate the national climate reporting work, maintain the reporting system that is needed, and produce and compile documentation for the reporting and leave the documentation to the government. Reports shall be made in particular under Regulation (EU) No 525/2013. The authorities that, according to this Regulation, participate in the climate reporting work shall ensure that the methods used for reporting maintain the quality that is needed for Sweden's climate reporting is done correctly and with the right information. The authorities must have internal procedures for planning, implementing, controlling, documenting and following up the quality work and consult with each other in order to develop and maintain a coordinated quality system. Reporting obligations are specified for various public bodies including, amongst others, the Swedish Board of Agriculture.

Policy: Ley N° IX-0921-2014 - Promoción y desarrollo de energías renovables.
Policy_Content: Esta Ley declara de interés provincial la investigación, desarrollo, generación, explotación, comercialización y consumo de energía renovable en todo el territorio de la Provincia de San Luis. En este marco la Ley establece disposiciones específicas con el fin de: a) diversificar la matriz energética provincial; b) propiciar el crecimiento económico, el empleo, el avance tecnológico y la integración territorial a través de la instalación de nuevos emprendimientos en materia de energías renovables; c) incentivar la radicación de industrias destinadas a la producción de equipos y componentes para la utilización de fuentes de energías renovables; d) planificar y promover el desarrollo electro-energético provincial en materia de fuentes de energías renovables; e) fomentar el desarrollo sustentable de la Provincia; f) promover la capacitación, investigación y desarrollo en materia de energías renovables; g) promover las inversiones del sector público o privado en emprendimientos de generación de energía a partir del uso de fuentes renovables.

Policy: Decreto Supremo N° 2.195 – Establece un mecanismo para la asignación porcentual de la compensación financiera por impactos socio ambientales de las Actividades, Obras o Proyectos hidrocarburíferos, cuando se desarrollen en Territorios Indígena Originario Campesinos – TIOCs, tierras comunales, indígenas o campesinas.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto regula el mecanismo para la asignación porcentual de la compensación financiera por impactos socio ambientales de las actividades, obras o proyectos hidrocarburíferos, cuando se desarrollen en Territorios Indígena Originario Campesinos. Estas disposiciones se enmarcan en el artículo 119 de la Ley Nº 3.058 de 2005, de Hidrocarburos, el cual dispone que cuando las actividades hidrocarburíferas se desarrollen en tierras comunitarias de origen, comunales, indígenas o campesinas, tituladas o no, todo impacto socioambiental negativo directo, acumulado y a largo plazo, que las mismas produzcan, debe ser compensado financieramente por parte de los titulares de las actividades hidrocarburíferas, de manera justa, respetando la territorialidad, los usos y costumbres de los afectados, tomando como base, el Estudio de Evaluación de Impacto Ambiental y otros medios que permitan valorar los daños no cuantificables.

Policy: European Union (Marine Equipment) Regulations 2014 (S.I. No. 540 of 2014).
Policy_Content: These Regulations define restrictions on the placing certain equipment on board Irish ships. Equipment of a kind specified in an item of Annex A.1 to Council Directive No. 96/98/EC shall not be placed on board an Irish ship unless the equipment: (a) meets the requirements of the international instruments specified in columns 3 and 4 of the item, and has been tested and assessed for conformity as specified in columns 5 and 6 of the item, and (b) bears a mark in accordance with Article 11 of and Annex D to the Directive. The Minister may at any rate prohibit placing on board od such equipment if dangerous to public health or the environment. The testing standards that shall apply shall be those that apply under the international maritime conventions of the International Maritime Organisation including MARPOL.

Policy: Common Agricultural Policy Single Payment and Support Schemes (Cross Compliance) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2014 (S.R. No. 291 of 2014).
Policy_Content: These Regulations make provision in Northern Ireland for the administration and enforcement of compliance of farmers with standards regarding "good agricultural and environmental condition" as expressed by Regulation (EU) No. 1306/2013, Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) No 640/2014 and Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) No 809/2014. These Regulations concern a direct support schemes under the Common Agricultural Policy. The Department of Agriculture and Rural Development, as the competent national authority, shall be responsible for providing farmers with a list of the statutory management requirements and standards of good agricultural and environmental condition on their land as required by Regulation (EU) No. 1306/2013. The standards concern: establishment of buffer strips along water courses; irrigation authorisations; protection of ground water against pollution; minimum soil cover; minimum land management reflecting site specific conditions to limit erosion; maintenance of soil organic matter levels; retention of landscape features; protection of semi-natural habitats.

Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 183 articles divided into 13 Chapter, prescribes rural and urban house ownership, development, management and use; house transactions; and state management of housing in Vietnam. Transactions of purchase, sale, lease or lease-purchase of commercial houses of real estate businesses and cooperatives must comply with the law on real estate business. This Law applies to organizations, households and individuals involved in urban and rural house ownership, development, management, use and transactions, and state management of housing in Vietnam. The State shall create residential land areas through approving land use master plans and plans, urban master plans, master plans on special functional zones and master plans on rural construction. The State shall promulgate mechanisms and policies on planning, land, finance, credit, research and application of science and technology, and new building materials for the renovation or reconstruction of condominiums which are severely damaged and in danger of collapse and become unsafe for users, and encourage organizations, households and individuals to participate in the development of houses for lease, lease-purchase or sale under the market mechanism.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Asia, East Asian Seas, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Cabinet Regulation No. 724 of 2014 on Methods for Determination of the Odours Caused by Polluting Activity, as well as the Procedures for Restricting the Spread of such Odours
Policy_Content: This Regulation prescribes the methods for determination of the odours caused by polluting activity; and the procedures for restricting the spread of the odours caused by polluting activity. Conformity with the odour guideline value shall be ensured (1) in the following functional zones, which are referred to in general spatial planning, use and building regulations and which are determined by a spatial plan, local plan or detailed plan: private house building territory; low-storey residential building territory; multi-storey residential building territory; public building territory; mixed centre building territory; and nature and greenery territory; and (2)in land units or parts of land units, the current type of use of which is public building, residential building or public outdoor space with all amenities, regardless of the functional zoning determined in the spatial plan, local plan or detailed plan (except the case if it is private building in rural territory, which is located in the property of the operator itself). The requirements of the Regulation shall not apply to mobile sources of pollution.
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Policy: Protection Forest Strategy Glarus
Policy_Content: The strategy details the need for action to ensure the long-term protection of the Glarus protection forest. In accordance with the plan, a protection forest is a forest that protects people, animals, goods and infrastructures from mud flow, floods, and driftwood. It also protects against landslides, erosion, avalanches and rockfall. The protective forest therefore serves to protect from these threats or limit their damage to a large extent.  The strategy states the goals of protective forest management, describes the current state of the forest, compares this with the requirement profiles (NaiS) and specifies the need for action. It further shows the necessary silvicultural measures and explains how measures are implemented by the forest services and the private forest owners. Short-term, mid-term and long term goals are distinguished. The general organizational structures as well as the financing and costs of the undertakings are prescribed in the final chapter.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Order No. 1261 on Green Development and Demonstration Programme (GDDP).
Policy_Content: This Order sets regulations concerning the financial contributions to competitive and sustainable food and non-food production with the aim of developing commercial potential in the organic sector at high levels – such as climate change, environmental and nature protection; animal welfare; and food safety and health. The Order implements Act on Green Development and Demonstration Program (GDDP) which consists of a modern enterprise system of support to address some of the key challenges for food industry. Grants may be awarded for projects in agriculture (excluded forestry), and fishing and aquaculture. Approval for grants under this Order shall be granted to parties referred to in article 11 of GDDP Act (owners, tenants and users of farms, commercial fishing and aquaculture sites; private companies and industry associations and the like; non-profit institutions; and public and private research institutions). The Danish AgriFish Agency is the secretariat of the Board of GDDP (see article 3.1 of GDDP Act) and regulates the administration of this Order. The Agency shall exercise the powers of the Minister for Food, Agriculture and Fisheries.

Policy: Executive Order No. 174 establishing the Philippine Greenhouse Gas Inventory Management and Reporting System (PGHGIMRS).
Policy_Content: This Executive Order, consisting of 10 sections, establishes the Philippine Greenhouse Gas Inventory Management and Reporting System (PGHGIMRS). The PGHGIMRS aims to institutionalize the GHG inventory management and reporting system in relevant government agencies to enable the country to transition towards a climate-resilient pathway for sustainable development. The Reporting System shall be responsible for: providing direction and guidance in the accounting and reporting of GHG emissions from identified key source sectors in order to develop and maintain centralized, comprehensive, and integrated data on GHGs; developing a system for the archiving, reporting, monitoring, and evaluating GHG inventories in all key sectors; and providing and facilitating continuous capacity building initiatives in the conduct of GHG inventories to ensure application of updated methodologies.

Policy: Law No. 5.418 providing for the Solid Waste Policy.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 50 articles divided into eleven Chapters, establishes the Solid Waste Policy. It specifies principles, objectives and instruments, as well as the procedures, standards and criteria regarding the generation, packaging, storage, transportation, treatment and final disposal of solid waste within the territory of the Federal District. The Policy aims at controlling pollution and contamination, as well as minimizing its environmental impacts, in accordance with Federal Law No. 12.305 of 2 August 2010. The objectives of the Policy are: protection of public health and environmental quality; non-generation, reduction, reuse, recycling and treatment of solid waste, as well as environmentally appropriate final disposal; encouraging the adoption of sustainable patterns of production and consumption of goods and services; adoption, development and improvement of clean technologies as a way to minimize environmental impacts; reducing the volume of hazardous waste; promote the recycling industry, with a view to encouraging the use of raw materials and inputs derived from recycled materials; integrated solid waste management; articulation between the public power and the business sector, with a view to technical and financial cooperation for integrated solid waste management; continuous technical training in the area of ​​solid waste; public services for urban cleaning and solid waste management; integration of reusable and recyclable material collectors into actions involving shared responsibility for the product life cycle; encouraging the implementation of the product life cycle assessment; encouraging the development of environmental and business management systems aimed at improving production processes and reusing solid waste, including recovery and energy use, etc.

Policy: Finland’s National Climate Change Adaptation Plan 2022.
Policy_Content: Finland’s National Strategy for Adaptation to Climate Change adopted in 2005 aims to reinforce and enhance the capacity to adapt to climate change in Finland. The focus of the adaptation strategy is the national level and the approach is sector-based. The key objective of the adaptation strategy is to incorporate adaptation as a cross-cutting perspective into the planning, activities and follow-up within the sectors. The strategy deals with the impacts of climate changes and proposes measures to be introduced immediately as well as lines of action to be followed over longer term. Incorporation of climate change adaptation into national development plans is promoted. The objective is to reduce poverty, improve food security, promote the sustainable use of natural resources, increase the amounts of water and cultivable land available and access to sustainably produced energy, support social stability and equality and, through all this, prevent uncontrollable migratory flows both within counties and across borders.

Policy: Order No. 1212 on obligatory energy audit in large commercial enterprises.
Policy_Content: The Order sets regulations concerning the mandatory auditing of energy supply provided by commercial and large companies and subsidiaries in Denmark and Danish subsidiaries of large foreign companies (commercial activities employing at least 250 employees and with an annual turnover of minimum EUR 50 million, or with an annual balance of min. EUR 43 million). It applies in particular to energy and environmental management systems, including content, scope, reporting, verification and application of relevant standards and whether full or partial exemptions are necessary for energy audits covered by other legislations. Prior to 5 December 2015, energy audits must be carried out by DANAK (The Danish Accreditation Fund) accredited professionals and at least every 4 years. Energy audit shall meet the following requirements: Updated, measured, traceable operating data on energy (1); Include a detailed review of the energy profile of buildings or groups of buildings, industrial activities or facilities, and transportation (2); Construction of a life cycle cost analysis instead of simple payback periods to take into account long-term savings, long-term investments residual values and discount rates whenever possible (3); Be proportionate and sufficiently large to make it possible to draw an accurate picture of the overall energy performance and reliably identify the most significant opportunities for improvement (4); Allow for detailed and validated calculations of the proposed measures, so as to provide accurate information on potential savings (5); The data used in energy audits shall be retained by the operator for historical analysis and development of energy performance.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Regional Law No. 96-oz “On public control”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities of organization and performance of public control as a form of public participation. It shall not be applicable to elections and referendum. Regional executive bodies shall have the following plenary powers: (a) formation of advisory councils at the regional executive bodies; (b) examination of final documents drafted by public control bodies; and (c) consideration of proposals, recommendations and conclusions contained in the final documents. Policy: Decision No. 64/2014/QD-TTg on specific policies on relocation and resettlement of people in areas under irrigation and hydropower projects.
Policy_Content: This Decision, consisting of 24 articles divided into five Chapters, applies to the payment of compensations, support and resettlement of people in areas under the following projects: a) Irrigation and hydropower projects prescribed in Clause 1, Article 87 of the 2013 Land Law; b) Projects approved by the Prime Minister, including hydropower projects proposed by the Ministry of Industry and Trade and irrigation projects proposed by the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development; c) Irrigation and hydropower projects prescribed at Point a of this Clause, which are funded with ODA but not subject to any commitments on framework policies on compensation, support and resettlement; d) Other issues related to compensation and supply for and resettlement of people in areas under irrigation and hydropower projects comply with the 2013 Land Law, the Government's Decree No. 47/2014/ND-CP of 15 May 2014, on compensation, support and resettlement upon land recovery by the State and other relevant laws. This Decision applies to the provision of support for relocated people to stabilize their livelihood and production upon resettlement under irrigation and hydropower projects for which payment of compensations, provision of support and resettlement have been completed. Chapter II deals with Compensation, Support and Resettlement upon Land Recovery by the State.

Policy: Ozone Depleting Substances (ODS) Regulations, 2014 (S.I. No. 140 of 2014).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made by the  Minister of Environment, Wildlife and Tourism under section 18 of the National Meteorological Service Act, provide for the control of Ozone Depleting Substances (ODS). ODS are any chemical substance which destroys the ozone layer and is controlled under the Montreal Protocol and listed in Schedules I and Il of these Regulations. The Regulation prohibit the manufacturing and emission into the air of ODS. They place restrictions in the importation or exportation of (recycled) substances set out in column II of Schedule 1 ("controlled substances") or equipment or goods that are dependent on controlled substances. Importation or exportation of certain substances require  a permit, whereas international trade in other substances is prohibited altogether. A permit holder shall not transfer a permit to a third party. There shall be kept a register of permits and permit holders have certain reporting obligations. The Regulations also provide for customs control and provide some rules regarding transportation of controlled substances.

Policy: Decree No. 278 of 2014 (XI. 14.) Korm. of the Government on the content and the method of preparation of the report related to greenhouse gas emissions, as well as to climate change, on the rules of data reporting and the fine payable in case of infringement of the data reporting obligation.
Policy_Content: This Decree shall apply to public entities keeping and elaborating data and information necessary for the operation of the National Registration System and reporting activities under the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change and of the Kyoto Protocol and other national implementing regulations. It shall apply also to greenhouse gas emission sources which emissions equal or exceed 100 tonnes of CO2 equivalent. This Decree comprises five chapters. Chapter I regards the scope of the Decree. Chapter II provides rules on the operation of the System. Chapter III contains rules on national reporting activities. Chapter IV concerns sanctions in case of omission of data supply obligations and the publicity of reports. Chapter V provides final provisions. Annex 1 lists public entities, while Annex 2 lists greenhouse gas emission sources subject to data supply and reporting obligations.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 566-PP/14 validating the Regulation on regional state nature reserve “Kayta”.
Policy_Content: Regional state nature reserve “Kayta” shall be constituted for conservation and recovery of natural complexes and maintenance of ecological balance of Kanda, Ena and Vatsimanjioki river basins. Regional state nature reserve “Kayta” shall perform the following functions: (a) conservation of ecosystems, natural landscapes and natural complexes (including wetlands); (b) conservation of rare and endangered mushrooms, plants and animals, and genetic resources of the aforesaid species; (c) conservation and reproduction of biological diversity; and (d) conservation of high aesthetic and recreational values for promotion of ecological and scientific tourism. The following activities shall be prohibited: (a) timber extraction and harvesting of non-timber forest products; (b) exploration and mining; (c) ploughing up; (d) use and storage of pesticides and other toxic chemicals; (e) waste disposal and littering of the territory; (f) removal of objects of cultural heritage; and (g) introduction and release of alien species.

Policy: Plan Nacional de Desarrollo 2015-2018 “Alberto Cañas Escalante”.
Policy_Content: El presente instrumento contiene el Plan Nacional de Desarrollo 2015-2018, el cual refiere a los programas, proyectos y acciones estratégicas para alcanzar los siguientes objetivos sectoriales: 1) aumentar el valor agregado agropecuario, impulsando la mejora en la productividad y el desarrollo rural sostenible; 2) apoyar la meta nacional de reducción de la pobreza mediante acciones que mejoren las condiciones de vida en los territorios rurales y propicien la dignificación de la población rural. El documento enuncia los programas, proyectos y acciones estratégicas relativos a estos dos objetivos (así como los correspondientes indicadores), tanto a nivel nacional como en algunos casos a nivel regional.  El Plan presenta un nuevo modelo de desarrollo que está basado en los siguientes principios orientadores: 1) diálogos ciudadanos; 2) solidaridad; 3) sostenibilidad ambiental y gestión del riesgo; 4) equidad e igualdad de género; 5) responsabilidad; 6) ética; 7) rendición de cuentas; 8) transparencia en la función pública; 9) accessibilidad universal. El modelo se sustenta a su vez en los siguientes tres pilares: 1) impulsar el crecimiento económico y generar empleo de calidad; 2) combate a la pobreza y reducción de la desigualda; 3) un Gobierno abierto, transparente, eficiente, en lucha frontal contra la corrupción. El cuadro 2 del apartado 3.4 identifica los objetivos y metas nacionales a corto y mediano plazo (2015-2018) y a largo plazo (2030) correspondientes a los mencionados pilares.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition

Policy: Estratégias Marinhas para as Águas Marinhas Portuguesas. Monitoring and Measures Programmes of the Marine Strategy Framework Directive (DQEM).
Policy_Content: Directive 2008/56/EC of ​​the European Parliament and of the Council of 17 June, or the Marine Strategy Framework Directive (DQEM), transposed into National Law by Decree-Law No. 108/2010 of 13 October, as amended, establishes a framework for community action within which Member States must take necessary measures to achieve or maintain a good environmental status in the marine environment until 2020. DQEM aims to protect, preserve and enhance the marine environment, preventing its deterioration and ensuring, whenever possible, its restoration, as well as the prevention and progressive reduction of marine pollution, in order to ensure that there are no significant risks marine biodiversity, marine ecosystems, human health and legitimate uses of the sea. These objectives must be achieved through the application of marine strategies based on an ecosystem approach, aiming to achieve a sustainable balance between the pressure 32 exerted by human activities and the conservation of marine ecosystems. Within the scope of this directive, the strategies to be developed are fundamental for obtaining and maintaining good environmental status and for guaranteeing the sustainable use of marine goods and services, thus safeguarding the potential for uses and activities of current and future generations. Accordingly, the Directive provides that each Member State establishes and implements a strategy to be applied to marine waters under its sovereignty or jurisdiction. The elaboration of this strategy must take into account the marine regions or sub-regions.

Policy: National Framework on Forest Measures for Rural Development 2014-2020.
Policy_Content: The National Framework on Forest Measures for Rural Development was adopted in implementation of Regulation (EU) No. 1305/2013 of the European Parliament and of the Council on support for rural development by the European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development (EAFRD). Policy: National Implementation Plan for the Stockholm Convention.
Policy_Content: This National Implementation Plan (NIP) for the management and phase out of Persistent Organic Pollutants (POPs) is a nationwide sectoral document, compiled in accordance with article 7 of the Stockholm Convention on POPs, updating the first NIP of 2007. It aims at (i) giving an overview of Sudan current level of compliance with the Convention requirements in respect to initial POPs; (ii) giving an overview on the situation of the new listed POPs and how Sudan is planning to address them in an integrated manner. The NIP integrates the following cross-sectoral issues, mainly concerning some related socioeconomic aspects, such as (i) food and water safety (including POPs exposure of population); (ii) POPs exposure of vulnerable and highly exposed groups; (iii) treatment of POPs-contaminated materials and the cost of destruction; (iv) end of life management; and (v) cost of POPs contaminated soil and site remediation. Considering the socio-economic burdens of POPs and related waste management, the document implementation shall take into account the following approaches and principles (i) the precautionary approach; (ii) extended producer responsibility; and (iii) the polluter pays principle.

Policy: Política Pública Nacional para la Sequía - 2014.
Policy_Content: La Política Pública Nacional para la Sequía - 2014, en el marco del Programa Nacional contra la Sequía (PRONACOSE), se propone formular una política pública para atender la sequía, que pueda impulsar el cambio de paradigma institucional y al mismo tiempo utilizar como su instrumento principal el PRONACOSE. La Política Pública cuenta con objetivos, misión, visión, estrategia y los principios básicos siguientes: Enfoque preventivo, Descentralización, Gobernanza, Capacitación e investigación, Gradualidad y Evaluación, y Coordinación institucional. Los dos elementos que la componen son: 1) Prevención, que incluye monitoreo-alertamiento, programas por cuenca, por usuario o uso, investigación, evaluación y actualización de los programas; 2) Mitigación o Atención, que incluye acciones durante y después del evento de sequía, que buscan reducir la participación federal y aumentar la participación local, y se complementa con una línea de acción que corresponde a los actos de autoridad para garantizar el agua para consumo humano.

Policy: Anti-Corruption Commission Act.
Policy_Content: This Act aims to provide for the establishment of the Anti-Corruption Commission in order to combat corruption, and to provide for matters connected with or incidental to the foregoing. The Anti-Corruption Commission shall be a body corporate capable of suing and being sued in its corporate name and, subject to this Act, of performing all acts that bodies corporate may by law perform. There shall be an Anti-corruption Commission consisting of at least four and not more than nine members appointed by the President-Chairperson.  Members of the Zimbabwe Anti-Corruption Conmmission must be chosen for their integrity and their knowledge of and experience in administration or the prosecution or investigation of crime or for their general suitability for appointment. The Zimbabwe Anti-Corruption Commission has the following functions: (a) to investigate and expose cases of corruption in the public and private sectors; (b) to combat corruption. theft, misappropriation, abuse of power and other improper conduct in the public and private sectors; (c) to promote honesty, financial discipline and transparency in the public and private sectors; 3 (d) to receive and consider complaints from the public and to take such action in regard to the complaints as it considers appropriate; (e) to direct the Commissioner-General of Police to investigate cases of suspected corruption and to report to the Commission on the results of any such investigation; (f) to refer matters to the National Prosecuting Authority for prosecution; (g) to require assistance from members of the Police Service and other investigative agencies of the State; and (h) to make recommendations to the Government and other persons on measures to enhance integrity and accountability and prevent improper conduct in the public and private sectors. Subject to this Act, the objects of the Commission shall be— (a) to promote the investigation of serious cases of corruption and fraud; (b) to make proposals for the elimination of corruption in the public and private sectors; (c) to promote awareness among the public of the causes of corruption and its effects on society; (d) to propose new or more effective procedures for the administration of the Commission.
Subject: General

Policy: Law No. 18.295 creating the Environmental Regularization Programme for Rural Properties of the State of Paraná (PRA).
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 13 Chapters, creates the Environmental Regularization Programme for Rural Properties of the State of Paraná (PRA). It establishes the above mentioned Environmental Programme within the State of Paraná, comprising a set of actions and initiatives to be developed by landowners and users in order to adapt and promote environmental compliance in accordance with Chapter XIII of the Federal Law No. 12.651. This Law establishes the instruments of the Environmental Regularisation Programme which are: the Rural Environmental Registry - CAR; the Commitment Agreement; the Recovery of Degraded Areas Project - PRAD, and Environmental Reserve Compensation. It specifies rural family property requirements in order to benefit from financial aspects; protecting measures to be adopted for the recovery of Permanent Preservation Areas, presented by PRAD; the regulating instrument of Legal Reserve area if necessary; performance schedule of measures which should integrate the PRAD. In rural properties, described in art. 3 of the Federal Law No. 12.651, the Government will provide technical support for the restoration of the vegetation of the Legal Reserve, through the dissemination of technical information and seedlings of native species and agroforestry interest, in accordance with programmes established by the Government of State of Parana.

Policy: Order No. 1191 on subsidy for Natura2000 projects to create natural water level conditions.

Durante la elaboración del Plan de Reducción de Desastres, el inversionista, de conjunto con el explotador de la instalación, acordará un nivel de riesgo aceptable. El inversionista, para la evaluación del nivel de riesgo aceptable, sobre la base de los estudios de riesgo de desastres realizados, así como de los elementos vulnerables, debe definir los siguientes aspectos: 1) hasta qué categoría, de cada uno de los peligros de desastres apreciados, se logra elevar la resistencia de la instalación, en cada uno de sus elementos vulnerables; 2) qué actividades de respuesta (enfrentamiento) complementan las medidas permanentes de proyecto, para aquellas categorías de desastres que están por encima de la resistencia que garantiza la inversión; 3) el análisis costo-beneficio realizado para proponer la variante definitiva.

Policy: Law No. 140-V “On consumer protection”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes organizational, legal and socio-economic basis of the state policy in the sphere of consumer protection. It regulates the issues of retail purchase and sale of commodities in accordance with purchase and sale contracts. State policy in the sphere of consumer protection is aimed at: (a) protection of rights and legal interest of the consumers; (b) improvement of legal basis related to consumer protection; and (c) ensuring provision of the consumers with high quality commodities and services. In order to protect their interests the consumers shall be authorized to set up voluntary consumer associations. State bodies, through their competent representatives shall exercise control and inspection in the sphere of consumer protection.

Policy: Resolution COEMA/TO No. 53 providing for the silvo-forestry activity in converted areas, reforestation and granting of credits.
Policy_Content: This Resolution, consisting of 3 Chapters and four Annexes, provides for the silvo-forestry activity in converted areas, reforestation and granting of forestry credits. It establishes the requirements to be satisfied in order to perform the above mentioned activities within the State. Chapter II specifies that forest reforestation activity of native or exotic species in converted areas will be permitted only outside of the Legal Reserve and Permanent Preservation Areas - APP and its environmental licensing will comply with the terms of current National legislation. Chapter III deals with the Control over Forestry Products. Credits for reforestation purposes will be issued only after having conducted technical inspection to prove the actual reforestation of tree species, whether native or exotic.

Policy: Regulation on emission standards for certain types of installations, fuel combustion sources and appliances for waste incineration or co-incineration.
Policy_Content: The objective of this Regulation of the Minister of Environment is to prevent and reduce as far as possible the direct and indirect effects of emissions. The present Regulation lays down: (1) types of installations for which emission standards concerning introduction of gas or dust into the air should by determined; (2) types of fuel combustion sources for which emission standards concerning introduction of gas or dust into the air are determined; (3) emission standards conerning introduction of gas or dust into the air for installations, fuel combustion sources and appliances for incineration or co-incineration of waste; (4) other requirements concerning meeting emission standards for certain types of installations, fuel combustion sources and appliances for incineration or co-incineration of waste. The present Regulation consists of the following Sections: General provisions (sect. 1); Sources of fuel combustion (sect.2); Installations and appliances for incineration and co-incineration of waste (sect. 3); Installations for processing asbestos or products containing asbestos (sect. 4); Installation for the production of titanium dioxide (sect. 5); Installations where organic solvents are used (sect. 6); Transitional and final provisions (sect. 7).

Policy: Sri Lanka Atomic Energy Act, No. 40 OF 2014.
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 91 sections divided into four Parts and one Schedule, provides for the establishment of the Sri Lanka Atomic Energy Board; for the promotion and encouragement of the use of Nuclear Science and technology for national development purposes; for the establishment of the Sri Lanka Atomic Energy Regulatory Council; for the Regulation of practices involving Ionizing Radiation and the Safety and Security of Sources; for the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons and ensuring safeguards. It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the Sri Lanka Atomic Energy Board which shall consist of the members referred to in section 6. The objectives of the Board shall be to: a) promote and encourage the peaceful application of nuclear technology and provide services using such technology; b) conduct research on nuclear science and on developing peaceful application of nuclear technology, for the purpose of achieving national objectives; c) promote and support innovations to ensure safety and security systems and quality in the peaceful uses of nuclear technology; d) provide radiation protection services to meet regulatory requirements relating to nuclear applications; and e) engage in activities involving ionizing radiation and complementary techniques, for commercial or other purposes.

Policy: Ley Nº 182 - Ley del Bosque Modelo de Puerto Rico.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley declara política pública del Estado Libre Asociado de Puerto Rico la conservación y desarrollo sustentable del paisaje agrícola y forestal de la región conocida como el Bosque Modelo de Puerto Rico. Se entiende por bosque modelo el territorio definido de desarrollo sustentable, en donde la población que reside en el área planifica la gestión de los bienes y servicios suministrados por el bosque u otros ecosistemas, de una manera consensuada. La Ley promueve modelo participativo donde las comunidades, el gobierno estatal, los gobiernos municipales, la academia, el sector comercial e industrial, asociaciones profesionales, entidades privadas, agricultores, grupos defensores de los recursos naturales o culturales y proveedores de servicios sin fines de lucro, entre otros sectores, establezcan alianzas para trabajar en conjunto estrategias coherentes de conservación, seguridad alimentaria, formas de producción económica sustentable y mejoramiento social, dentro de un marco de gobernanza participativa. La Ley define los principios aplicables a este respecto en al ámbito de la agricultura y el turismo. En cuanto al marco institucional, la Ley crea la Oficina del Bosque Modelo de Puerto Rico y el Fideicomiso del Bosque Modelo.

Policy: Loi n°46-2014 du 3 novembre 2014 portant mesures de promotion et de développement des très petites, petites et moyennes entreprises.
Policy_Content: La présente loi régit les très petites entreprises; les petites entreprises; les moyennes entreprises, excepté les banques et les établissements financiers et de garantie ; les compagnies d’assurances ; et les agences immobilières. La très petite entreprise est celle qui emploie au plus neuf salariés permanents et réalise un chiffre d’affaires annuel hors taxes de vingt-cinq millions de francs CFA au maximum. La petite entreprise est celle qui dispose d’un capital social minimum d’un million de francs CFA à sa création, qui emploie entre dix et vingt salariés et réalise un chiffre d’affaires annuel hors taxes supérieur à vingt-cinq millions de francs CFA, mais n’excédant pas cent millions de francs CFA. La moyenne entreprise est celle dont le capital social à la création est supérieur à un million de francs CFA, qui emploie un effectif permanent compris entre vingt et un et cent salariés et réalise un chiffre d’affaires annuel hors taxes supérieur à cent millions de francs CFA, mais n’excédant pas deux milliards de francs CFA. A cet effet, elle prévoit les des mesures d’appui, d’aide et de soutien en faveur des très petites, petites et moyennes entreprises (mesures d’ordre général, appui à la création des très petites, petites et moyennes entreprises, soutien à l’exploitation des très petites, petites et moyennes entreprises); les conditions d’accès (éligibilité, des droits et des obligations des très petites, petites et moyennes entreprises, et cadre organique); des infractions et des sanctions (constatation des infractions et sanctions).

Policy: Loi n° 2014-27 du 3 novembre 2014 modifiant la loi n° 65-60 du 21 juillet 1965 portant Code pénal.
Policy_Content: La presente loi modifie la loi n° 65-60 du 21 juillet 1965 portant Code pénal. Concrètement, elle modifie l'article 368, en ajoutant l'article 368 bis à fin de apporter une réponse à la mesure du problème du vol de bétail. Le nouveau article puni le vol du bétail, notamment: s'il est fait usage d'effraction, d'escalade, de sape ou de fausses clés; si le vol est commis dans un lieu destiné à l'exercice d'un culte; sil le vol portant sur du bétail a été commis au préjudice d'une personne qui tire de l'exploitation dudit bétail essentiel de ses revenus ou qui fait de son élevage son activité principale; si le vol est commis par un domestique ou un salarié à l'occasion de son service; si le vol est commis par un aubergiste; si le vol est commis la nuit; et si le vol est commis en prenant le titre d'un fonctionnaire public ou d'un officier civil ou militaire, ou après s'être revêtu de l'uniforme ou du costume du fonctionnaire ou de l'officier.

Policy: Plan d’Organisation de Secours du Tchad.
Policy_Content: Le Plan ORSEC est une politique sectoriel que vise à doter le Pays d’outils capables lui permettant de mieux répondre aux différentes catastrophes et crises humanitaires. Il s'inscrit dans le cadre global et stratégique de la planification de défense et de sécurité civiles et est destiné à faciliter la mobilisation et l'engagement rapide de moyens exceptionnels lorsque les moyens ordinaires des services publics de secours sont dépassés par l'ampleur d'une catastrophe ou par le nombre de victimes. Les objectifs généraux visés à travers la panification ORSEC sont, d'une part, de définir un cadre permanent d'organisation et de coordination des opérations de secours d'urgence et de relèvement précoce en mobilisant les ressources nécessaires et en identifiant les acteurs appelés à intervenir face à une catastrophe sévère sur le territoire tchadien; et d'autre part, il s'agit de réduire l'impact des catastrophes et de construire la résilience de la nation tchadienne en fixant une procédure générale de gestion des crises et urgences, de prise en charge des victimes et de relèvement des personnes, des biens et de l'environnement affectés, à travers une coordination efficace des opérations. Les objectifs spécifiques du Plan sont: de mettre au point une organisation administrative et un dispositif opérationnel susceptibles de faire face à toutes les catastrophes prévisibles ou non prévisibles d'une gravité particulière; de désigner les autorités et les organisations appelées à participer à la gestion des catastrophes et fixant, selon leurs status, leur spécialisations, leur effectifs et leurs matériels, les missions et actions assignées à chacune d'elles; de mobiliser l'ensemble des moyens humains, matériels et financiers, locaux nationaux et internationaux, publics, privés et humanitaires nécessaires à la mise en oeuvre des opérations de secours, de relèvement et de réhabilitation.

Policy: Regulations pertaining to the Financial Provision for the Rehabilitation and Closure  and Post Closure of Prospecting, Exploration, Mining or Production Operations, 2014 (GN 940 of 2014).
Policy_Content: These Regulations are made under section 44(aG), (aH) read with sections 24(5)(b)(ix), 24P and 24R of the National Environmental Management Act, 1998. The purpose of these Regulations is to regulate the method for determining and making financial provision (as defined in section 1 of the Act) for the costs associated with the management of environmental impacts from prospecting, exploration, mining or production operations. The Regulations shall apply to a holder under the Mineral and Petroleum Resources Development Act, 2002 and regulate the method for estimation of the cost and budgeting for costs associated with the management of environmental impacts from prospecting, exploration, mining or production operations through the life of a mine and that may become known in the future. A holder must make financial provision for: (a) rehabilitation; (b) decommissioning and closure activities at the end of the life of mine; and (c) remediation and management of latent or residual environmental impacts which may become known in the future, including the pumping and treatment of polluted or extraneous water. A licence holder shall must submit various plans and an environmental impact assessment as set out in the Appendices to these Regulations. An Assessment of costs must be done annually and an annual rehabilitation plan must contain all information set out in Appendix 3 to these Regulations. The final rehabilitation, decommissioning and mine closure plan must contain all information set out in Appendix 4 to these Regulations and an environmental risk assessment must contain all information set out in Appendix 5 to these Regulations.

Policy: Arrêté A/2014/5474/PM/SGG du 31 octobre 2014, portant création, attributions, organisation et fonctionnement du Comité national de développement et de coordination de la propriété intellectuelle (CNDCP).
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté crée un Comité National de Développement et de Coordination de la Propriété Intellectuelle (CNDCPI). Le Comité National de Développement et de Coordination de la Propriété Intellectuelle (CNDCPI) est chargé d'assister le Gouvernement à formuler des stratégies nationales de propriété-intellectuelle et/ou d'innovation en adéquation avec les politiques et objectifs de développement et à élaborer des plans d'action nationaux axés sur le plan d'action et d'orientation stratégique de l'Organisation Africaine de la Propriété Intellectuelle (OAPI). A cet effet, il a pour missions de : faire des propositions au Gouvernement pour la promotion de la créativité par le biais d'une utilisation efficiente de la propriété intellectuelle dans les différents secteurs de l'économie ainsi qu'une meilleure défense des auteurs et des créateurs ; assurer une coordination des politiques et stratégies sectorielles en matière de propriété intellectuelle ; promouvoir les innovations, les technologies endogènes et le transfert de technologie pour améliorer la compétitivité des PME en vue de la valorisation des résultats de recherche et des produits locaux ; Initier des politiques et stratégies favorables à l'amélioration d'un environnement institutionnel attractif pour l'investissement national et étranger ; mettre en place une politique de formation et d'intégration de la propriété intellectuelle dans les cycles d'enseignement technique et supérieur en vue de stimuler une culture de propriété intellectuelle et d'entreprenariat ; proposer au Gouvernement des politiques de valorisation des savoirs traditionnels, des ressources génétiques et du folklore ; assurer la médiatisation et la vulgarisation de la propriété intellectuelle par la sensibilisation et la formation. Les membres de ce comité sont issus des ministères intéresses, du secteur privé et de la société civile.

Policy: Land Management Law (2014)
Policy_Content: The Law determines principles for land management in Latvia. Its purpose is to promote sustainable use and protection of land. The following principles are identified by the Law in the use and protection of land: (1) in planning the use of land, the local government provides for efficient management and sustainable development of natural resources in the spatial development planning documents; (2) the local government must indicate territories with the lowest land quality assessment and territories which due to their location and configuration are not appropriate for the use in agriculture or forestry, as priority for changing the category of the agricultural land and forest land; (3) the local government in the spatial development planning documents must indicate degraded territories as priority for building; and (4) the land owner, possessor, and user may not cause harm to land and must take into account a balance between the needs of the society and the rights of owners.

Policy: Law on Development Finance Institution (2014)
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Law is to ensure effective operation of the Development Finance Institution in implementing aid and development programmes and also ensuring the performance of other delegated public administration tasks that are specified in laws and regulations, implementing the State policy in the field of national economy. Within the meaning of this Law, aid and development programme is a programme that is fully or partially implemented in the form of financial instruments or grants and is financed according to the provisions laid down in Section 13 of this Law. Financial instruments are loans, guarantees, export credits, export credit guarantees and financing of export insurance, holding in the capital of commercial companies, investments in funds, including in alternative investment funds and also other financial instruments specified in laws and regulations. This Law prescribes the organisational structure, administration and financial management of the Finance Institution, the procedures for the development, approval, implementation and monitoring of programmes thereof and also activities in the performance of other delegated public administration tasks specified in laws and regulations. The Finance Institution shall implement programmes in the following fields and for the following purposes: (1) development of small and medium-sized economic operators and also commencement of commercial activities; (2) micro-crediting; (3) construction, reconstruction and renovation of residential properties; (4) development of State and local government infrastructure; (5) environmental protection; (6) development of business infrastructure; (7) technological development and innovation; (8) formation of venture capital; (9) development of agriculture, processing of agricultural products, rural areas, fishery and forestry; (10) promotion of the employment of socially sensitive population groups and implementation of other social aid programmes; (11) promotion of co-operation; (12) aid to region requiring special support; (13) promotion of export; (14) implementation and co-funding of the European Union programmes and projects; and (15) implementation and co-funding of the programmes and projects of international finance institutions and also in other fields of aid specified in laws and regulations and for other purposes specified in laws and regulations.

Policy: RONWAN Consolidation Act 2014 (No. 23 of 2014).
Policy_Content: This Act winds up the Nauruan Land Owners Royalty Trust Fund, the Nauru Rehabilitation Fund and other dormant funds. It also requires the Cabinet may make regulations prescribing any matter or thing required or authorised by this Act to be prescribed or which is necessary or convenient to be prescribed for carrying out or giving effect to this Act. The Nauru Phosphate Royalties Trust (NPRT) was a sovereign wealth fund developed by the government of the Republic of Nauru in which the government invested money from the state owned mining company, Nauru Phosphate Corporation. This money was then re-invested in a real estate portfolio, among other things, to provide the government with a reliable national income following the depletion of minable phosphates on the island. Policy: Decreto Presidencial Nº 2.167 - Política de Alimentación y Nutrición.
Policy_Content: Mediante el presente Decreto se aprueba la Política de Alimentación y Nutrición (PAN), un instrumento multisectorial de alcance nacional que abarca el período 2014-2025. El objetivo general de la Política, que se inserta en el marco del Saber Alimentarse para Vivir Bien, es lograr que la población boliviana tenga un estado nutricional adecuado, asegurando el consumo de alimentos variados que cubra los requerimientos nutricionales en todo el ciclo de vida, mediante el establecimiento y fortalecimiento de programas de alimentación y nutrición culturalmente apropiados, acciones de información y educación a la población boliviana sobre los valores nutricionales de los alimentos y su preparación. El documento define cinco objetivos específicos, a cada uno de los cuales se vinculan uno o más programas de soporte. Entre los principios que rigen la política se incluye el principio de soberanía productiva y alimentaria, como así también el fortalecimiento de la economía familiar campesina, indígena, originaria y afrodescendiente; se reconoce asimismo la exigibilidad y justiciabilidad del derecho humano a la alimentación adecuada. Los objetivos específicos son los siguientes: a) fomentar la producción de alimentos sanos, nutritivos, inocuos y culturalmente apropiados para contribuir a la seguridad alimentaria con soberanía; b) contribuir a la mejora del estado nutricional y prevenir la malnutrición; c) garantizar el agua para la vida en el área rural del país; d) mejorar el hábito alimentario de la nutrición; e) contribuir a la reducción de la desigualdad económica y disminuir la pobreza.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Water

Policy: Forestry Act 2014.
Policy_Content: This Act makes provision with respect to a variety of matters affecting forestry in Ireland: administration of forestry sector; felling of trees; forest management plans; general and special functions of the Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine and the role of minister in safeguarding environment; removal or destruction of vegetation on land; preservation orders; afforestation, forest road works and aerial fertilisation of forests; replanting; enforcement; regulation-making powers of the Minister; and offences and penalties. The Minister may establish one or more committees to assist and advise him or her in the performance of any of his or her functions under the relevant statutory provisions. The Minister may issue notices concerning destruction of vegetation on land, or destruction of vermin and preservation or replanting orders. Where a person wishes to fell or otherwise remove any tree or trees or to undertake afforestation, forest road works or aerial fertilisation of forests, he or she shall apply to the Minister for a licence to do so. Certain provisions of the Act concern the prervation of water quality.

Policy: Arrêté du Gouvernement flamand fixant les règles relatives aux paiements directs en faveur des agriculteurs au titre des régimes de soutien relevant de la politique agricole commune.

Le paiement ne peut être direct qu'aux agriculteurs actifs, tels que définis par la troisième section du premier chapitre. Le deuxième chapitre de l'arrêté explique l'activation du système de droits au paiement alors que le troisième s'occupe des paiements directs et du système de droits au paiement. Le quatrième chapitre Prévoit l'établissement d'une aide couplée, pour le maintien de l'élevage spécialisé de vaches allaitantes et pour la production de veaux de boucherie. Un agriculteur qui reçoit des paiements directs respecte les exigences en matière de gestion, ainsi que les normes relatives aux bonnes conditions agricoles et environnementales, visées au chapitre cinq (respect d'une zone exempte de produits phytopharmaceutiques, respect des procédures d'autorisation pour l'utilisation d'eau à des fins d'irrigation, respect de l'interdiction de déversement direct et indirect dans les eaux souterraines de substances dangereuses reprises dans l'annexe 1re etc.).

Policy: Governor’s Decree No. 204-ug validating the Regulation on protection zone of nature monument of regional significance “Uvodye water storage reservoir”.
Policy_Content: The scope of creation of protection zone of nature monument of regional significance “Uvodye water storage reservoir” shall be prevention of adverse anthropogenic effects thereon. Economic and other activities causing damages to natural complexes and wild fauna and wild flora species shall be prohibited, in particular: (a) performance of works that violate the hydrogeological regime of the water storage reservoir, lead to the emergence and development of soil erosion processes; (b) soil pollution, littering of the territory, organization of landfills (including snow dumps) and dumping of domestic and non-domestic waste; (c) placement of storage points pesticides, fuels and lubricants; (d) effluent waste water discharge; (e) placement of cemeteries, cattle burial grounds; (f) construction of gas stations, provision of vehicle repair services; (g) vehicle traffic outside public roads and parking off-road (except for authorized vehicles) and outside specially equipped parking lots; (h) exploration and mining common widespread minerals, except for authorized exploration and mining; (i) timber extraction, except for sanitary felling, and unauthorized cutting of green vegetation; (j) washing of vehicles; (k) use of buildings and structures, during the operation of which toilet and sewage and other liquid waste are generated, without cesspools; and (l) disturbance of habitats of rare and endangered plant species, mushrooms and wild fauna species recorded in the federal and in the regional Red Books. The following activities shall be authorized: (a) construction and reconstruction of facilities, organization of parking lots in accordance with acting federal legislation ensuring environmental protection; (b) recreation of the population, walks; (c) collection of plants and mushrooms, except for protected, endangered and rare species recorded in federal and regional Red Books; (d) haymaking and grazing of cattle; (e) sanitary felling and authorized cutting of green vegetation; (f) hunting in accordance with hunting permits; (g) recreational activities and events; (h) organization of camps and tourist stations; (i) conducting study tours, classes, seminars; (j) smallholding, horticulture and gardening in inhabited areas; and (k) authorized uses of urban land.

Policy: Ordinance No. 1024-r of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Concept to combat land degradation and desertification.
Policy_Content: Concept to combat land degradation and desertification is a nationwide multi-sectoral policy document aimed at the solution of the most serious challenges for the country’s sustainable development, causing significant environmental and socio-economic problems. The largest degradation processes are water and wind soil erosion (about 57 percent of the country’s territory), land flooding (about 12 percent), acidification (almost 18 percent), salinization and solonization of soils (more than 6 percent). According to various criteria, about 20 percent of Ukrainian land are polluted. Almost 23,000 landslides are recorded annually. As a result of abrasion, up to 60 percent of the coast of the Azov and Black Seas and 41 percent of the coastline of the Dnieper reservoirs are destroyed. More than 150,000 hectares of land have been disturbed as a result of mining and other activities. The number of underground and surface karst manifestations is about 27 thousand hectares of land. The problems of land degradation and desertification are exacerbated by the rapid pace of climate change, accompanied by rising average annual temperatures, recurrence and intensity of extreme weather events, including droughts, which have impact every two - three years on 10 to 30 percent of the country's territory, and every 10-12 years - 50 to 70 percent of the country’s total area. The level of poverty in rural areas, which traditionally depends more on the state of use and protection of land and other natural resources, during the last 10 years is 2-11 percent higher than the national average, leading to excessive exploitation of natural resources, their further depletion and degradation.

Policy: Directive 2014/95/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Directive 2013/34/EU as regards disclosure of non-financial and diversity information by certain large undertakings and groups.
Policy_Content: This Directive is adopted in the framework of the European Union Strategy 2011-14 for Corporate Social Responsibility, adopted on 25 October 2011. It supplements Directive 2013/34/EU which lays down rules on the annual financial statements, consolidated financial statements and related reports of certain types of undertakings. In particular, new article 19a is inserted. This new provision regards disclosure of non-financial and diversity information by certain large undertakings and groups. In particular, large undertakings which are public-interest entities (and exceeding on their balance sheet dates the criterion of the average number of 500 employees) shall include in the management report a non-financial statement containing information to the extent necessary for an understanding of the undertaking's development, performance, position and impact of its activity, relating to, among other aspects, environmental matters and respect for human rights. Article 29a is inserted as well. The latter concerns the consolidated non-financial statement to be included by public-interest entities which are parent undertakings of a large group.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Regulation (EU) No. 1144/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council on information provision and promotion measures concerning agricultural products implemented in the internal market and in third countries and repealing Council Regulation (EC) No. 3/2008.
Policy_Content: With a view to enhancing the competitiveness of the European Union agricultural sector, this Regulation lays down the conditions under which information provision and promotion measures concerning agricultural products and certain food products based on agricultural products implemented in the internal market or in third countries may be fully or partially financed from the Union budget.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition

Policy: Directive 2014/94/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council on the deployment of alternative fuels infrastructure.
Policy_Content: This Directive establishes a common framework of measures for the deployment of alternative fuels infrastructure in the European Union in order to minimize dependence on oil and to mitigate the environmental impact of transport. This Directive sets out minimum requirements for the building-up of alternative fuels infrastructure, including recharging points for electric vehicles and refuelling points for natural gas (LNG and CNG) and hydrogen, to be implemented by means of Member States' national policy frameworks, as well as common technical specifications for such recharging and refuelling points, and user information requirements. Each Member State shall adopt a national policy framework for the development of the market as regards alternative fuels in the transport sector and the deployment of the relevant infrastructure.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Regulation on conditions for feeding domestic animals with pasture from land on which organic fertilizers and soil improvers are applied.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, based on the provisions of the Law on animal by-products (Republika Srpska), prescribes the conditions for feeding domestic animals by grazing and silage from the land (pastures) on which organic fertilizers and soil improvers are applied. This text further defines the terms such as pastures, organic fertilizers and soil improvers (pasture is land covered with grass which is used for grazing domestic animals; organic fertilizers are organic substances of plant or animal origin which are added to the land with the basic purpose of plant nutrition; soil improvers are substances that are added into the soil with the primary purpose of improving the physical or chemical characteristics of the biological activity of the soil). Organic fertilizers and soil improvers must be applied in accordance with manufacturer's instructions for use or in accordance with good production/farming practice. After the application of organic fertilizers and soil improvers on pastures, domestic animals shall not be allowed access to grazing for 21 days after such treatment; after the expiration of 21 days from the application of organic fertilizers and soil improvers, such pasture may be used for grazing of domestic animals or can be mowed for the purpose of obtaining silage.
Subject: Livestock, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe
